when one line or surface tilts in relation to another.', 'Tilted - Describing a state of being slanted or not vertical due to some force or influence.', 'Banked - A road, slope, or track that is angled for safety and control during motion (e.g., car racing).', 'Slouch - To bend the upper part of your body forward at the waist; can be associated with tilting posture but not directly related to tapping.', 'Angle-stepped - Referring to steps that have an angle, often used in stairs or ramps where a tilt is involved for accessibility reasons.', 'Gravitational pull - The force of attraction exerted by a celestial object; not directly related but can cause tilting.', 'Tilter (as in "tilter and drainer") - A device used to pour liquid, often found with a tilt mechanism that involves angling the container.', 'Pitch-angled - Similar to an angle-stepped; specifically refers to roofs or structures having slopes for water runoff.', 'Tilting mirror - A reflective surface designed to change view depending on its orientation and tilt.', 'Cambered (as in "cambered road") - Roadways intentionally constructed with a slight curve or slope, typically used for drainage purposes but involves tilting surfaces.', 'Angled shot - In photography/cinematography, capturing the image at an angle rather than straight on; can involve tilt-related movements of camera equipment.', 'Tilter (as in "tile") - A flat piece typically used for covering roofs or floors that may be angled during installation.', 'Incline pad - A mat with a gentle slope, often used for walking over an elevated surface without the need to climb stairs; involves tilt-related design.', 'Angle of repose - The steepest angle at which a sloping surface formed of a particular loose material is stable; relates to the concept of tilting but not directly related to tapping.', 'Tilting carriage - An early form of vehicle with wheels mounted on an axle that was steered by means of a tiller or wheel, which involved some degree of tilt for turning maneuvers.', 'Tilt barrel (as in "tilt-a-whirl") - A spinning ride found at fairs and amusement parks featuring seats mounted on a tilting structure; ['Bookmark - To save or mark a page in a book or webpage to revisit easily later.', 'Save - A function in computing systems used to store files, data, or documents for future access.', 'Snippet - A small piece of code or text that can be saved and reused at a later time.', 'Archive - To gather and preserve digital information for long-term storage and easy retrieval when needed.', 'Cache - A temporary storage area in computing systems, used to store frequently accessed data for quicker access in the future.', 'Backup - The process of creating copies or duplicates of important files or data stored elsewhere for safety against loss or damage.', "Memoize - To cache a function's output so that it can be quickly retrieved without recomputation when called again with the same inputs.", 'Pinning - In digital services like email, pinning messages to your inbox keeps them visible and easily accessible for future reference.', 'Tagging - Attaching labels or keywords to a piece of content (e.g., photos, documents) for easy searching and retrieval at a later date.', 'Indexing - Creating an index or searchable list of entries that facilitate finding information quickly in large datasets.', 'Bookmarking - Saving web pages or links to be accessed easily from your bookmarks bar (in browsers).', 'Offline sync - A feature that allows data synchronization between online and local storage, ensuring access when offline.', 'Queue - Storing tasks in a sequence for execution at an optimal time later on.', 'Shadow copy - Creating copies of files or system states to facilitate recovery from accidental deletions or changes.', 'Versioning - Keeping different versions of documents, software, etc., allowing you to revert back to previous iterations if needed.', 'Zipping - Compressing files into a .zip archive for easy storage and quick access when unzipped later on.', 'Cloud storage - Storing data remotely in the cloud (on servers maintained by third-party providers) for retrieval from anywhere with internet connectivity.', 'Snapshots - Creating point-in-time copies of system states, databases or configurations to revert back if necessary.', 'Booking - Securing future appointments, reservations, or services by saving them in a calendar or booking management system for easy access later on.', 'Queueing - Storing tasks or data in a queue (line) structure that ensures orderly processing and retrieval at designated times.']
